sentences: Lapsilla on erilaiset tarpeet iästään riippuen.
context: The Finnish word 'ikä' means age or years of life. It's used to refer to how old someone is or the duration of time someone has lived. In the examples, it appears in different forms: 'ikäni' (my age), 'nuori ikältään' (young in age), and 'iästään riippuen' (depending on their age).
